physical_appearance:\The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. The foreground of the photograph captures the image of the shopkeeper
 whose shop is present at the background of the photograph. A male worker is present behind the counter while a customer waits for his order. Food such as crackers and mineral water bottles are hanging on the display racks. Numerous glass cups are stacked on the counter. A sign informing customers of \\self-service\\ is present above the counter.\
subject_terms_1:canteens (eating and recreation spaces) railroad stations coffee shops shopkeepers
subject_terms_2:Black-and-white photography Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Canteens (Establishments) Railroad srarions Coffee shops Shop-keeper
subject_terms_3:Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Photography Rail transport (Stations) Tanjong Pagar Railway Station
sgcool_label_text:\This image features Mr Masudul Hasan
 who operated the M. Hasan Railway Food Canteen on Platform 1 of the Tanjong Pagar Railway Station before the closure of the station. His older brother ran another eatery in the main concourse of the station. This image is part of the \\Tracking Memories\\ collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore

metadata.physical_appearance: "The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. The foreground of the photograph captures the image of the shopkeeper, whose shop is present at the background of the photograph. A male worker is present behind the counter while a customer waits for his order. Food such as crackers and mineral water bottles are hanging on the display racks. Numerous glass cups are stacked on the counter. A sign informing customers of ""self-service"" is present above the counter."

His older brother ran another eatery in the main concourse of the station. This image is part of the ""Tracking Memories"" collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore
